page.title: 11LITTLE CLAYDONS FARM C'FORD
page.content: During the war in 1944, a V 2 bomb fell at Little Claydons Farm and left a big hole where the farmhouse was. The farm has 222 acres and it was mentioned in the original Domesday Book. They have 200 cows and each cow produces about 4 gallons of milk a day. The cows are milked twice a day, first at 5 a.m. and again at 3 p.m. The milk is sold to the Milk Marketing Board every day. About 200 calves are born each year. The cows are very upset when their calves are taken away. The farm has a machine which lifts the cows on to their sides, in order to have their hooves trimmed. In the winter the cows are put into cubicle buildings. There are two tower silos about 70 feet high which are used for storing cattle food.
